pageContext.collection_description: Contains scripts, correspondence and miscellaneous printed items covering Lang's career at WIS beginning in 1941. Lang wrote public service scripts during World War II, including those for the Victory Bond program which were broadcast coast-to-coast and Let's Go to Town which were sent to service men. Also contains material on WIS history, including a 340-page annotated typescript entitled "So Rich a Heritage: A History of WIS Radio and Television."
